intro: Porphyrostemma cuanzensis, commonly known as the Cuanzense Porphyrostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
